issue.title: System.NotSupportedException: The property 'X.Y' does not have a value set and no value generator is available for properties of type 'bool'. Either set a value for the property before adding the entity or configure a value generator for properties of type 'bool' in 'OnModelCreating'.

repository.name: EFCorePowerTools
repository.description: Entity Framework Core Power Tools - reverse engineering, migrations and model visualization in Visual Studio & CLI

body: @Krzem0 are you seeing the same problem when scaffolding directly with EF, without the EF power tools (i.e. `dotnet ef dbcontext scaffold`)? Just to exclude the possibility of an issue that has nothing to do with EF.

Unfortunately yes. After scaffolding db by command
```
Scaffold-DbContext 'your connection string here' Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer -Context TestContext -ContextDir Context -OutputDir Models -Force -NoOnConfiguring
```
and ofcourse adding some nugget packages (except two existing, listed in first post):

- Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design 8.0.1
- Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore 8.0.1
- Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Relational 8.0.1
- Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Tools 8.0.1

I've ended with the same generated DbContext and entity classes. Which still throw exception. When I change this property to nullable bool by hand, it works well. I remember it wasn't that long ago, that scaffolding was generating nullable bools in such situations. Am I wrong? :)

For test purposes I've created another table:
```
CREATE TABLE [Testing].[List2](
	[Id] [uniqueidentifier] NOT NULL,
	[Description] [nvarchar](max) NULL,
	[IsActive] [bit] NOT NULL,
	[IsActive2] [bit] NOT NULL,
 CONSTRAINT [PK_TestingList2] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED 
(
	[Id] ASC
)WITH (PAD_INDEX = OFF, STATISTICS_NORECOMPUTE = OFF, IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF, ALLOW_ROW_LOCKS = ON, ALLOW_PAGE_LOCKS = ON, OPTIMIZE_FOR_SEQUENTIAL_KEY = OFF) ON [PRIMARY]
) ON [PRIMARY] TEXTIMAGE_ON [PRIMARY]
GO

ALTER TABLE [Testing].[List2] ADD  DEFAULT (newsequentialid()) FOR [Id]
GO

ALTER TABLE [Testing].[List2] ADD  CONSTRAINT [DF_List_IsActive2]  DEFAULT ((1)) FOR [IsActive2]
GO

ALTER TABLE [Testing].[List2]  WITH CHECK ADD  CONSTRAINT [CK_ID2] CHECK  (([Id]<>'00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000'))
GO

ALTER TABLE [Testing].[List2] CHECK CONSTRAINT [CK_ID2]
GO
```
Column [IsActive] scaffolds to bool, and [IsActive2] also to bool. Despite the fact that  IsActive2 has constraint default 1, both of them saves to database in right way, without exception. Hence it looks like to me, a bit column in complex primary key can cause the problem.
ðŸ˜…
Note for triage: confirmed regression when bool property is part of a composite generated primary key.

issue.title: Stop throwing eagerly when looking up a ValueGenerator

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Fixes #32892

The issue was introduced by the fix for stable/unstable values. In that fix, we were missing that a value generator exists and influences whether the generated value is considered stable or not. However, some types, most notably bools, don't have a default generator. This is fine, it just means that there isn't a generator to use.

I removed the exception entirely because we never now throw if we can't find a generator--it's always okay. This is technically a breaking change, and people do create their own selectors, so we should probably doc it.
